WRITING.TITLE: [Product question] Substitute for Aztec secret indian clay mask
WRITING.TEXT:
I've just finished my Aztec clay mask and it was expensive to buy it from Europe. I have oily acne prone skin and this mask seems to help me a lot, but I would like to know if any of you know about another clay mask (that comes in powder) instead of this. I have been reading the clay's descriptions and I'm not sure if I should buy a bentonite or another one.
Thank you.
lol yes they are.
It looks like there are 4 carrots inside the glass.
How many microfibers do you have? I thought about it, but it would mean to use 2 everyday...
I use sunscreen with some colour and a bit of concealer under my eyes, also some eye liner, that's it...
Thanks, maybe is that I'm using too little... I'll try tomorrow with a bit more. I think is great, my skin is much more moisturized!
I was using wipes, but I don't feel like they are enough... Thanks for the advise :)
I read about Albolene here, it seems to be a very good makeup remover and hydrating, I use cotton pads with it for the eyes area though.
I have that sometimes, I think is because of stress, but just guessing. I have some samples of Paula's Choice anti redness moisturizing and it helps.

WRITING.TITLE: How do you properly use Albolene as makeup remover?
WRITING.TEXT: I've just bought a bottle of Albolene to remove my makeup and I think I'm not using it properly because after the double cleansing I apply a toner with a cotton pad and there is still a bit of dirt sometimes. I take a hazelnut size amount and spread it all over my face with my hands, then I rub it, not very hard, and I remove it with some paper. I then use the Calendula cleanser of Kiehl's. Any tip to improve it? Thanks
In Spain we have it too.
Naruko Tea Tree Sunscreen is great for oily-acne prone skin.

WRITING.TITLE: [SELL/SWAP] Tonymoly
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]
The constant feeling that time passes and I get old and I have less and less time of being alive. Always feeling that I, m on a death row.

I Don,t get that sub. Could you ELI5?
Edit: I got it
[This one](http://www.sensora.co.uk/micellar-oil-233-p.asp) is very good for senstivie skin.

I was surprised. I live in Spain and the shipping costs from US were super high, so I searched in /r/skincareaddictionuk and I found this, it had super good reviews. Is quite simple, and honestly, it smells kind of funny, but I guess every vitamin c does. Still, it hasn't broke me out, which is surprising and I see my phi quite better. I keep it in the fridge and I use it in the morning as I read is not recommended to use it with your acids. :)

I'm using [this one](http://www.sr-skincare.co.uk/30ml-10-vitamin-c-serum-25-p.asp) since september and so far so good, it doesn't smell good, but is helping to fade my phi and so far it hasn't broke me out (I'm super acne prone)
Thank you very much
Thank you!
Do you have sources? It would be great

WRITING.TITLE: Is it true that corn is sterile?
WRITING.TEXT: I've been having a discussion with friends, and some of them say that corn is sterile, like Cavendish banana, and other say that is not, I promised them I'd find the answer, can you help me?

Hello,
I can't find CG shampoo or conditioner in Spain, except for L'oreal and I can't use their products. Do you know any good CG brands in Europe?

WRITING.TITLE: Can a woman use Rogaine for men?
WRITING.TEXT: My mum (58yo) is experiencing hair loss since the beginning of this year and she's starting to worry a lot about it, so I bought her Rogaine, but in the pharmacy they only had the one for men and I thought it was the same. Now she was going to apply it and she's read that is strictly for men's use, is this true? Can it cause side effects in women?
Great seller, very fast shipping and good communication. The products were great also!
Yes please
